root.description: Performs segmentation of an image, and output either a raster or a vector file. In vector mode, large input datasets are supported.

parameter.name: Segmentation algorithm
parameter.description: Choice of segmentation algorithm (mean-shift by default)

parameter.name: Range radius
parameter.description: Range radius defining the radius (expressed in radiometry unit) in the multi-spectral space.

parameter.name: Minimum region size
parameter.description: Minimum size of a region in segmentation. Smaller clusters will be merged to the neighboring cluster with the closest radiometry.

parameter.name: Scale factor
parameter.description: Scaling of the image before processing. This is useful for images with narrow decimal ranges (like [0,1] for instance).

parameter.name: Processing mode
parameter.description: Choice of processing mode, either raster or large-scale.

parameter.name: Output vector file
parameter.description: The output vector file or database (name can be anything understood by OGR)

parameter.name: Writing mode for the output vector file
parameter.description: This allows setting the writing behaviour for the output vector file. Please note that the actual behaviour depends on the file format.

parameter.name: Mask Image
parameter.description: Only pixels whose mask value is strictly positive will be segmented.

parameter.name: Stitch polygons
parameter.description: Scan polygons on each side of tiles and stitch polygons which connect by more than one pixel.

parameter.name: Minimum object size
parameter.description: Objects whose size is below the minimum object size (area in pixels) will be ignored during vectorization.

parameter.name: Simplify polygons
parameter.description: Simplify polygons according to a given tolerance (in pixel). This option allows reducing the size of the output file or database.

parameter.name: Layer name
parameter.description: Name of the layer in the vector file or database (default is Layer).

parameter.name: Geometry index field name
parameter.description: Name of the field holding the geometry index in the output vector file or database.

parameter.name: Tiles size
parameter.description: User defined tiles size for tile-based segmentation. Optimal tile size is selected according to available RAM if null.

parameter.name: Starting geometry index
parameter.description: Starting value of the geometry index field

parameter.name: OGR options for layer creation
parameter.description: A list of layer creation options in the form KEY=VALUE that will be passed directly to OGR without any validity checking. Options may depend on the file format, and can be found in OGR documentation.
